did.abstract: Letters from members of the Gill family dealing for the most part with personal affairs and family business. Contains accounts of the experiences of a girl at High Point Female Seminary, N.C., in 1860, including a description of the burning of books written by Hinton Rowan Helper on the seminary grounds; letters from a soldier in the 33rd North Carolina Regiment during the Civil War; and letters from a soldier in the 42nd North Carolina Regiment, 1862-1864.
